description.narrative: The project goal is to ensure the integrity of Eritrea’s diverse ecosystems in order to secure the viability of the nation’s globally significant biodiversity through operationalization of Protected Areas Management System.
first-order administrative division

description.narrative: - Project launched - Office established - Operational manual prepared

comment.narrative: Total hectares of critical habitat conserved within newly established national protected areas.

Through UNDP technical and financial support a range of sustainable ecosystem-based natural resources conservation and land restoration measures were implemented: construction of 930.7Km hillside and on-farm terraces, and 7,880m3 of check-dams (115 units in number) and planting of 62,800 tree species. In addition, over 13,000 hectares of marine and terrestrial habitats were put under strict biodiversity protection and natural restoration.
Total hectares of critical habitat conserved within newly established national protected areas.

Through UNDP technical and financial support, 1,000 hectares of land were managed sustainably under sustainable landscape restoration and conservation and climate-resilient agricultural practices. The ecosystem-based solutions included a range of natural resources conservation and restoration including construction of hillsides, on-farm terraces, and check-dams, planting of various tree species, and temporary and permanent strict closures. Moreover, about 14,000 hectares of marine and terrestrial habitats continued to be under strict protection and sustainable forest management.
